abstract member AddFaceFromStreamWithHttpMessagesAsync : string * Guid * System.IO.Stream * string * System.Collections.Generic.IList<int> * System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary<string, System.Collections.Generic.List<string>> * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Microsoft.Rest.HttpOperationResponse<Microsoft.Azure.CognitiveServices.Vision.Face.Models.PersistedFace>>
MemberSignature.Usage: iPersonGroupPerson.AddFaceFromStreamWithHttpMessagesAsync (personGroupId, personId, image, userData, targetFace, customHeaders, cancellationToken)

Docs.param: Id referencing a particular person group.
Id referencing a particular person.
An image stream.
User-specified data about the face for any purpose. The maximum length is 1KB.

A face rectangle to specify the target face to be added to a person in the format of "targetFace=left,top,width,height". E.g. "targetFace=10,10,100,100". If there is more than one face in the image, targetFace is required to specify which face to add. No targetFace means there is only one face detected in the entire image.
The headers that will be added to request.
The cancellation token.
Docs.summary: Add a representative face to a person for identification. The input face is specified as an image with a targetFace rectangle.
Docs.exception: Thrown when the operation returned an invalid status code
Thrown when unable to deserialize the response
Thrown when a required parameter is null

Id referencing a particular person.
Publicly reachable URL of an image
User-specified data about the face for any purpose. The maximum length is 1KB.

A face rectangle to specify the target face to be added to a person in the format of "targetFace=left,top,width,height". E.g. "targetFace=10,10,100,100".
